archetypeTraits: I judge people by their actions, not their words.
If someone is in trouble, I’m always ready to lend help.
When I set my mind to something, I follow through no matter what.
I have a strong sense of fair play and always try to find a balance.
I’m confident in my selfand do what I can to share that confidence.
Thinking is for other people. I prefer action.
I misuse long words in an attempt to sound smarter.
I get bored easily. When am I going to get on with my destiny?
I idolize a particular hero , and constantly refer to that person’s deeds
I see omens in every event and action.
Nothing can shake my optimistic attitude.
I quote (or misquote) sacred texts and proverbs in almost every situation.
I am tolerant of other faiths and respect the worship of others.
I am intolerant of other faiths and condemn the worship of others.
I've enjoyed fine food, drink, and high society among my temple’s elite.
I’ve spent so long in the job that I have little practical experience.
I fall in and out of love easily, and am always pursuing someone.
I have a joke for every occasion, especially when humor is inappropriate.
Flattery is my preferred trick for getting what I want.
I’m a born gambler who can't resist taking a risk for a potential payoff.
I lie about almost everything, even when there’s no good reason to.
Sarcasm and insults are my weapons of choice.
I keep multiple holy symbols on me and invoke whatever deity I need.
I pocket anything I see that might have some value.
I always have plan for what to do when things go wrong.
I am always stone calm, no matter the situation.
The first thing I do in a new place is note the valuables.
I am incredibly slow to trust.
I don't play attention to the risks in a situation.
The best way to get me to do something is to tell me that I can't do it.
I blow up at the slightest insult.
I know a story relevant to almost every situation.
I love to trade local rumors and indulge in gossip.
I’m a hopeless romantic, always searching for that special someone.
Nobody stays angry at or around me for long, I can defuse any tension.
I love a good insult, even one directed at me.
I get bitter if I’m not the center of attention.
I’ll settle for nothing less than perfection.
I change my mood or my mind as quickly as I change key in a song
I believe that anything worth doing is worth doing right.
I’m a snob who looks down on those who can’t appreciate fine art.
I always want to know how things work and what makes people tick.
I’m full of witty aphorisms and have a proverb for every occasion.
I’m rude to people who lack my commitment to hard work and fair play.
I like to talk at length about my profession.
I don’t part with my money easily and will haggle tirelessly.
I’m well known for my work, I want to make sure everyone appreciates it.
I'm always taken aback when people haven’t heard of me.
I like my isolation and rarely speak, preferring gestures and grunts.
I am utterly serene, even in the face of disaster.
I am eager to share the wisdom of my leaders.
I feel tremendous empathy for all who suffer.
I’m oblivious to etiquette and social expectations.
I connect everything that happens to a grand, cosmic plan.
I often get lost in my own thoughts, becoming oblivious to my surroundings.
I am working on a grand philosophical theory and love sharing my ideas.
My flattery makes others feel like the most wonderful person ever.
I am beloved for my kindness and generosity.
I carry my self as if I were a cut above the unwashed masses.
I take great pains to always look my best and follow the latest fashions.
I don’t like to get my hands dirty, and I hate unsuitable accommodations.
I believe I have a noble birth, but I am quite humble about it.
My favor, once lost, is lost forever.
If you do me injury, I'll crush you, ruin your name, and salt your fields.
I’m driven by a wanderlust that led me away from my original home.
I watch over my friends as if they were a litter of newborn pups.
I run everywhere I go and enjoy competitive sprinting.
I have a lesson for every situation, drawn from observing nature.
I place no stock in wealthy or well-mannered folk.
I’m always absently fiddling with things, sometimes breaking them.
I feel far more comfortable around animals than people.
I was, in fact, raised by beasts.
1 I use polysyllabic words that convey the impression of great erudition.
I like to boast about  every book I've ever read.
I am a natural and patient teacher, eager to share my expertise.
There’s nothing I like more than a good mystery.
I’m willing to listen to every side before I make my own judgment.
I . . . speak . . . slowly . . . to . . . everyone.
I am horribly, horribly awkward in social situations.
I’m convinced that people are always trying to steal my secrets.
My friends know they can rely on me, no matter what.
I work hard so that I can play hard when the work is done.
I enjoy traveling to new places and making new friends over flagons of ale.
I stretch the truth for the sake of a good story.
To me, a tavern brawl is a nice way to get to know a new city.
I never pass up a friendly wager.
My language is as foul as an otyugh nest.
I like a job well done, especially if I can convince someone else to do it.
I'm always polite and respectful.
I’m haunted by memories of war. I can’t get the images out of my mind.
I’ve lost too many friends, and I’m slow to make new ones.
I’m full of inspiring and cautionary tales from my military experiences.
I can stare down a hell hound without flinching.
I enjoy trying break things, and showing off my physicality.
I have a crude sense of humor.
I face problems head-on. A direct solution is the best path to success.
I hide scraps of food and trinkets away in my pockets.
I ask a lot of questions.
I like to hide and squeeze into small places.
I sleep with one eye open, and keep track of all my things.
I eat like a pig and have bad manners.
I think anyone who’s nice to me is hiding evil intent.
I don’t like to bathe.
I bluntly say what other people are hinting at or hiding.
I struggle with cultural understandings of personal space.
I have my own ideas about what is and is not food.
I have a code of honor or sense of propriety that others don't comprehend.
I express affection or contempt in ways that are unfamiliar to others.
I honor my deities through practices that are foreign to this land.
I begin or end my day with small traditional rituals that are unfamiliar.
I always have a joke on hand when the mood gets too serious.
I use sarcasm and insults to keep a distance between myself and friends.
I’ll settle for nothing less than perfection—in myself, and in my friends.
I’m focused on the glorious afterlife, nothing in this life can shake me.
I enjoy using my skills to help those who lack those same skills.
I have strong faith in an afterlife, but I’m not in a hurry to get there.
I’m perfectly happy letting others pick up the slack for me.
I’m constantly sizing up everyone around me, ready for a fight.
Everything I do, I do gracefully and deliberately, and with confidence.
Nothing can shake my rock-hard focus.
When I am at peace, I am an oasis of perfect calm in the world.
When I am roused to anger, I am an embodiment of terror.
I enjoy juicy tidbits of knowledge wrapped up in difficult puzzles.
I have the utmost faith in myself and my abilities.
I get restless when life in the city feels too tame, too safe.
I enjoy solitude as an opportunity to plan my victory.
I use satire as a way to undermine the teachings of the other gods.
I love, fight, and feast with equal zeal.
I think of those in my care as my family.
I don’t run from evil. Evil runs from me.
I like to read and memorize poetry. It keeps me calm
I spend money freely and live life to the fullest.
I live for the thrill of the hunt.
I don’t talk about the things that torment me.
I expect danger around every corner.
I refuse to become a victim, and I will not allow others to be victimized.
I put no trust in divine beings.
It will all go smoothly if everyone just does as I say.
Despair is an extravagance we can ill afford.
I know the writings of my deity backward and forward.
I try to see the bright side in the very worst situations.
It helps me feel better when others show sympathy or appreciation for me.
I prefer to face evil with a strong group of friends in front of me.
I want to see the wicked burn for the evil they’ve brought on us.
I feel the sin being purged from me as I help cleanse the world.

archetypeIdeals.name: Respect
archetypeIdeals.desc: People deserve to be treated with dignity and respect.

archetypeIdeals.name: Fairness
archetypeIdeals.desc: No one should get preferential treatment before the law.

archetypeIdeals.name: Freedom
archetypeIdeals.desc: Tyrants must not be allowed to oppress the people.

archetypeIdeals.name: Might
archetypeIdeals.desc: If I become strong, I can take what I want— what I deserve.

archetypeIdeals.name: Sincerity
archetypeIdeals.desc: There’s no good in pretending to be something I’m not.

archetypeIdeals.name: Destiny
archetypeIdeals.desc: Nothing and no one can steer me away from my higher calling.

archetypeIdeals.name: Tradition
archetypeIdeals.desc: The ancient traditions of worship and sacrifice must be preserved.

archetypeIdeals.name: Charity
archetypeIdeals.desc: I always try to help those in need, no matter what the cost.

archetypeIdeals.name: Change
archetypeIdeals.desc: We must help bring about the changes the gods are constantly working in the world.

archetypeIdeals.name: Power
archetypeIdeals.desc: I hope to one day rise to the top of my group's hierarchy.

archetypeIdeals.name: Faith
archetypeIdeals.desc: I trust that my deity will guide my actions, I have faith that if I work hard, things will go well.

archetypeIdeals.name: Aspiration
archetypeIdeals.desc: I seek to prove myself worthy of my god’s favor by matching my actions against their teachings.

archetypeIdeals.name: Independence
archetypeIdeals.desc: I am a free spirit— no one tells me what to do.

archetypeIdeals.name: Fairness
archetypeIdeals.desc: I always help the people who can't afford to get by.

archetypeIdeals.name: Charity
archetypeIdeals.desc: I distribute the money I acquire to the people who really need it.

archetypeIdeals.name: Creativity
archetypeIdeals.desc: I never try the same approach twice.

archetypeIdeals.name: Friendship
archetypeIdeals.desc: Material goods come and go. Bonds of friendship last forever.

archetypeIdeals.name: Aspiration
archetypeIdeals.desc: I’m determined to make something of myself.

archetypeIdeals.name: Honor
archetypeIdeals.desc: My word is my bond, and my people are my family.

archetypeIdeals.name: Freedom
archetypeIdeals.desc: Chains are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them.

archetypeIdeals.name: Charity
archetypeIdeals.desc: I steal from the wealthy so that I can help people in need.

archetypeIdeals.name: Greed
archetypeIdeals.desc: I will do whatever it takes to become wealthy.

archetypeIdeals.name: People
archetypeIdeals.desc: Friends before morals or ethics. Everyone else can take a leap.

archetypeIdeals.name: Redemption
archetypeIdeals.desc: I walked a dark path, now I seek the spark of good in everyone.

archetypeIdeals.name: Beauty
archetypeIdeals.desc: I want to make the world a better place than it was.

archetypeIdeals.name: Traditions
archetypeIdeals.desc: The stories, legends, and songs of the past must never be forgotten.

archetypeIdeals.name: Creativity
archetypeIdeals.desc: The world is in need of new ideas and bold actions.

archetypeIdeals.name: Greed
archetypeIdeals.desc: I’m only in it for the money and even more for the fame.

archetypeIdeals.name: People
archetypeIdeals.desc: My work is entirely motivated by the smiles on people's faces

archetypeIdeals.name: Honesty
archetypeIdeals.desc: Art should reflect the soul, it should come from within and reveal who we really are.

archetypeIdeals.name: Community
archetypeIdeals.desc: It is the duty of all civilized people to strengthen the bonds of community.

archetypeIdeals.name: Generosity
archetypeIdeals.desc: My talents were given to me so that I could use them to benefit the world.

archetypeIdeals.name: Freedom
archetypeIdeals.desc: Everyone should be free to pursue their own livelihood.

archetypeIdeals.name: Greed
archetypeIdeals.desc: I want to know everyone's secrets.

archetypeIdeals.name: Dignity
archetypeIdeals.desc: People deserve to be given the chance to hold themself as nobly as they can.

archetypeIdeals.name: Aspiration
archetypeIdeals.desc: One day I will be the best at what I do.

archetypeIdeals.name: Benevolence
archetypeIdeals.desc: My gifts are meant to be shared with all, not used for my own benefit.

archetypeIdeals.name: Logic
archetypeIdeals.desc: Emotions must not cloud our sense of what is right and true.

archetypeIdeals.name: Curiosity
archetypeIdeals.desc: Free thinking and inquiry and are the pillars of progress.

archetypeIdeals.name: Power
archetypeIdeals.desc: Solitude and contemplation are paths toward mystical or magical power.

archetypeIdeals.name: Tranquility
archetypeIdeals.desc: Live and Let Live. Meddling in the affairs of others only causes trouble.

archetypeIdeals.name: Inspiration
archetypeIdeals.desc: If you know yourself, there’s nothing left to know.

archetypeIdeals.name: Authority
archetypeIdeals.desc: Respect is due to those in charge. Pay respect or pay the price.

archetypeIdeals.name: Responsibility
archetypeIdeals.desc: With our stations come obligations that must be met.

archetypeIdeals.name: Independence
archetypeIdeals.desc: I must prove that I can handle myself without the coddling of my family.

archetypeIdeals.name: Independence
archetypeIdeals.desc: I must prove that I can handle myself without the coddling of my family.

archetypeIdeals.name: Power
archetypeIdeals.desc: If I can attain more power, no one will tell me what to do.

archetypeIdeals.name: Family
archetypeIdeals.desc: My direct relatives are more important than anything else to me.

archetypeIdeals.name: Chivalry
archetypeIdeals.desc: It is my duty to protect and care for the people beneath me.

archetypeIdeals.name: Change
archetypeIdeals.desc: Life is like the seasons, in constant change, and we must change with it.

archetypeIdeals.name: Community
archetypeIdeals.desc: Our actions must benefit the people of the society we live in.

archetypeIdeals.name: Honor
archetypeIdeals.desc: If I dishonor myself, I dishonor everything I stand for.

archetypeIdeals.name: Might
archetypeIdeals.desc: The strongest are meant to rule the weak.

archetypeIdeals.name: Nature
archetypeIdeals.desc: The natural world is more important than all the constructs of civilization.

archetypeIdeals.name: Glory
archetypeIdeals.desc: I must earn glory in battle, for everything I stand for.

archetypeIdeals.name: Knowledge
archetypeIdeals.desc: The path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge.

archetypeIdeals.name: Beauty
archetypeIdeals.desc: What is beautiful points us beyond itself toward what is true.

archetypeIdeals.name: Emotions
archetypeIdeals.desc: Our hearts cannot be clouded by stean unfeeling thinking.

archetypeIdeals.name: Potential
archetypeIdeals.desc: Nothing should fetter the infinite possibility inherent in all existence.

archetypeIdeals.name: Cosmetics
archetypeIdeals.desc: I am always the best dressed and the most put together in any room.

archetypeIdeals.name: Enlightenment
archetypeIdeals.desc: The goal of a life of study is the betterment of oneself.

archetypeIdeals.name: Respect
archetypeIdeals.desc: The thing that keeps a ship together is mutual respect between captain and crew.

archetypeIdeals.name: Fairness
archetypeIdeals.desc: We all do the work, so we all share in all rewards.

archetypeIdeals.name: Freedom
archetypeIdeals.desc: The laws of mortals cannot contain the freedom the gods bestowed upon us.

archetypeIdeals.name: Mastery
archetypeIdeals.desc: Every day I wake up, eager to sharpen my skills and hone my ability.

archetypeIdeals.name: Love
archetypeIdeals.desc: There is no force greater than the emotional bond between people.

archetypeIdeals.name: Justice
archetypeIdeals.desc: The strong must protect the weak, and even so, everyone has a place.

archetypeIdeals.name: Loyalty
archetypeIdeals.desc: Our leaders know what is best, and I would lay down my life for them.

archetypeIdeals.name: Obedience
archetypeIdeals.desc: I do what I must, and follow my orders to the letter.

archetypeIdeals.name: Independence
archetypeIdeals.desc: When people follow orders blindly, they embrace tyranny.

archetypeIdeals.name: Might
archetypeIdeals.desc: Life is a war, and the gods are on the side with more strength.

archetypeIdeals.name: Repentance
archetypeIdeals.desc: I seek forgiveness for a greivous sin I have once committed

archetypeIdeals.name: Nation
archetypeIdeals.desc: My city, nation, or people are all that matter.

archetypeIdeals.name: Solidarity
archetypeIdeals.desc: The worthy must respect the worthy. We're all in this together.

archetypeIdeals.name: Knowledge
archetypeIdeals.desc: We must cultivate nimble minds to perceive the wonders beyond our senses.

archetypeIdeals.name: Endurance
archetypeIdeals.desc: We must withstand the boundless slings and arrows of life.

archetypeIdeals.name: Faith
archetypeIdeals.desc: The worthy shall strive for greatness in the afterlife.

archetypeIdeals.name: Zeal
archetypeIdeals.desc: Passionate energy is the only evidence of conviction.

archetypeIdeals.name: Retribution
archetypeIdeals.desc: None shall harm another, lest they suffer the pain seven-fold.

archetypeIdeals.name: Solidarity
archetypeIdeals.desc: None shall harm another, lest they suffer the pain seven-fold.

archetypeIdeals.name: Honesty
archetypeIdeals.desc: The smallest deception paves the way to grievous sin.

archetypeIdeals.name: Piety
archetypeIdeals.desc: Devotion to the church is all that keeps the world from destruction.

archetypeIdeals.name: Order
archetypeIdeals.desc: The laws we forge are meant to preserve the social order—everything in its proper place.

archetypeIdeals.name: Compassion
archetypeIdeals.desc: Life is to be cherished and preserved against the horrors of the night.

archetypeIdeals.name: Productivity
archetypeIdeals.desc: We all must pitch in and contribute to the creation of our society.

archetypeIdeals.name: Punishment
archetypeIdeals.desc: It is better for the innocent to suffer than for the guilty to escape their due.

archetypeIdeals.name: Curiosity
archetypeIdeals.desc: I am always eager to try new things. Variety is the spice of life.

archetypeIdeals.name: Caution
archetypeIdeals.desc: I would rather be silent, than accidentally say something untoward.

archetypeIdeals.name: Adventure
archetypeIdeals.desc: I yearn for something exciting in my life.

archetypeIdeals.name: Cunning
archetypeIdeals.desc: Strategy and preparation can overcome any odds.

archetypeIdeals.name: Joy
archetypeIdeals.desc: Our brief existences should be over-filled with worldly delights.

archetypeIdeals.name: Preservation
archetypeIdeals.desc: We are fragile creatures, we must be wary of the intentions of others.

archetypeFlaws: I have the enynimity of the local authorities.
I’m convinced of the significance of my destiny
I have a shameful secret
I have a weakness for the vices of the city, especially hard drink.
Secretly, I believe that things would be better if I were in charge.
I have trouble trusting in my allies.
I judge others harshly, and myself even more severely.
I put too much trust in those who wield power within my group’s hierarchy.
My piety leads me to blindly trust those that profess faith like mine.
I am inflexible in my thinking.
I am suspicious of strangers and expect the worst of them.
Once I pick a goal, I become obsessed to the detriment of all else.
I can’t resist a pretty face.
I'm always in debt. I spend too much on decadent luxuries.
I’m convinced that I'm too clever to be fooled.
I’m too greedy for my own good. I can’t resist anything with money involved.
I can’t resist swindling people who are more powerful than me.
I can’t keep a secret to save my life, or anyone else’s
When I see something valuable, I can’t think about anything but stealing it.
When faced with a choice between money and friends, I'll choose the money.
If there’s a plan, I’ll forget it. If I don’t forget it, I’ll ignore it.
I have a “tell” that reveals when I'm lying.
An innocent is in prison for a crime that I committed. I’m okay with that.
I’ll do anything to win fame and renown.
I fall in love to easily, and can be lead astray by a clever wit.
A scandal prevents me from ever going home. Trouble seems to follow me.
I once angered a noble who still wants my head. I didn't learn my lesson
I have trouble keeping my thoughts and feelings to myself.
Despite my best efforts, I am unreliable to my friends
I’ll do anything to get my hands on something rare or priceless.
I’m quick to assume that someone is trying to cheat me.
No one must ever learn that I once stole money from guild coffers.
I’m never satisfied with what I have— I always want more.
I would kill to acquire a noble title.
I’m horribly jealous of anyone who can outshine my handiwork.
I enjoy worldly delights a little too much.
I harbor dark, bloodthirsty thoughts that I cannot quell.
I am dogmatic in my thoughts and philosophy.
I let my need to win arguments overshadow friendships and harmony.
I’d risk too much to uncover a lost bit of knowledge.
I like keeping secrets and won’t share them with anyone.
I secretly believe that everyone is beneath me.
I hide a truly scandalous secret that could ruin my family forevr.
I veiled insults and threats in every word, and I’m quick to anger.
I have an insatiable desire for carnal pleasures.
In fact, the world does revolve around me.
By my words and actions, I often bring shame to those around me.
I do not understand other's limits or desires well.
There’s no room for caution in a life lived to the fullest.
I remember every insult I’ve received and nurse a silent heavy grudge.
I am slow to trust members of other races, guilds, and societies.
Violence is my answer to almost any challenge.
I'm an aggressive bigot who believes other cultures are inferior.
Don’t expect me to save those who can’t save themselves.
I am easily distracted by the promise of information.
I am oblivious to danger, and contantly lost in thought.
Unlocking an ancient mystery is worth the price of a civilization.
I overlook obvious solutions in favor of complicated ones.
I speak without really thinking through my words.
I follow orders, even if I think they’re wrong.
I’ll say anything to avoid having to do extra work.
Once someone questions my courage, I never back down no matter what.
Once I start drinking, it’s hard for me to stop.
I can’t help but pocket loose coins and other trinkets I come across.
My pride will probably lead to my destruction
I quiver in fear at anything remotely dangerous.
I have little respect for anyone who is not a proven warrior.
I feel like a complete sham, and have no confidence in anything I do.
My hatred of my enemies is blind and unreasoning.
I obey the law, even if the law causes misery.
I’d rather eat my hat than admit when I’m wrong.
I imagine everyone has the best intentions, even if they clearly don't.
I follow my religious beliefs to secretive violent extremes
I will never fully trust anyone other than myself.
I’d rather kill someone in their sleep then fight fair.
I cannot remember names, faces, or events.
People who can't take care of themselves get what they deserve.
I am convinced of the superiority of my own culture over any other
I pretend not to understand the local language to avoid interations
I find everything around me boring, even in the most exciting times.
I have a deeprooted sadness that I struggle with every day
I cannot help but babble on about my own special interests
My competitive streak is stronger than anyone else's
I have certain rituals that I must follow every day.
I assume the worst in people, no matter what they've done or said.
I feel no compassion for the dead. They’re the lucky ones.
I have an addiction to a powerful drug, and will not admit it.
I am a purveyor of doom and gloom who lives in a world without hope.
I talk to spirits that no one else can see
Life is a series of trials and I believe the miserable are the most lucky
I wish I was a paladin, and I’m angry at the gods who didn’t choose me.
Working for a lifetime to die in the end seems like a big waste of time.
I fear an inglorious death will lead to an inglorious afterlife.
I have a lasting and vicious grudge against one of my companions.
This world is not what it seems, and something dark is going on here.
I am hopelessly in love, but this love is thwarted by outside forces.
I wish I had been an adventuerer, my life seems so dull in comparison.
I question whether the gods care at all about us or what we do.
A divine warrior seeks my death in retribution for a past insult.
I am deeply ashamed of my herritage, and wish I could hide my ancestry.
I secretly hope for a catastrophic end of the world.
There is an uncontrollable rage that lurks in my own heart.
The very sight of blood or injury makes me horribly sick.
I aggresively comment on the physical short-commings of others
I have a fondness of small creatures and collect too many pets
I might have made a promise to a demon that I can’t keep.
I died once, and was resurrected as a fluke. I have no fear of death now.
